sentences.en: A large proportion of the best citizens hated his despotism.
sentences.cn: 一大部分最好的公民都痛恨他的专制君主统治.

sentences.en: Bastille: ( 1370~1789 ) Medieval fortress in Paris that became a symbol of despotism.
sentences.cn: 巴士底狱: ( 1370～1789 ) 巴黎的中世纪要塞,成为专制的象征.

sentences.en: Bureaucracy is the derivation of feudal despotism, it is a long and complex historical phenomenon.
sentences.cn: 官僚主义是封建专制主义的派生物, 是一种长期存在的、复杂的历史现象.

sentences.en: Despotism was at its height towards the end of his reign.
sentences.cn: 在他统治的最后阶段专制达到了顶峰.

sentences.en: Despotism: Rule by or as if by a despot; absolute power or authority.
sentences.cn: 专制: 如同或被专制者统治; 绝对权力或权威.

sentences.en: EVEN if I granted all that I have been refuting, the friends of despotism would be no better off.
sentences.cn: 即使我接受我所反驳的所有观点，专制主义拥护者的日子也好不到哪里去。

sentences.en: He can recognise a despot, and the occasions when despotism has to be checked, by force if necessary.
sentences.cn: 他能够一眼识破专制的表象，以及这种专制应该何时有必要使用武力加以控制。

sentences.en: I cannot know all the factors that go into the continuing success of my despotism.
sentences.cn: 我无法知道,能够成功的维持统治的所有因素.

sentences.en: If it does not mean bourgeois despotism, then there is no sense to it at all.
sentences.cn: 不是资产阶级的专制主义, 就是毫无常识了.

sentences.en: In essence it is the howl of the die - hards for bourgeois despotism.
sentences.cn: 这种叫嚣,其本质就是顽固分子们的资产阶级专制主义.

sentences.en: Medieval fortress in Paris that became a symbol of despotism.
sentences.cn: 巴黎的中世纪要塞,成为专制的象徵.

sentences.en: There was nothing to fear from the Egyptians, accustomed as they were to despotism since the Pharaonic age.
sentences.cn: 关于埃及人，没有什么好恐惧的，因为他们自法老时期就已经习惯于专制了。

sentences.en: Whoever rejects it does of necessity fly to anarchy or to despotism .
sentences.cn: 谁否认它，谁就必然走向无政府或专制。
